title: kotajikikox
author: kotajikikox
content: Robert Kennedy Jr. says he has put most of his wealth into bitcoin. He was once running to be the president as third party but later on withdrew and joined to support Trump instead. If anyone is to be praised for being pro-bitcoin, it should be him. He’s been advocating for bitcoin even before the campaign.What I really like about this guy is that he said he bought each of his children 2 bitcoins. Not only is he investing for his future but also for the future of his children. I also would reach a point where I can afford to buy my children at least a bitcoin each. He says he’s fully committed to bitcoin. This means he believes in it as much as he says. No hesitation. What about you, did you put most of your money into bitcoin too? What are your thoughts about buying your children bitcoins as well?

comments.author: jcojci
comments.body: No, I don't invested most of my money in Bitcoin because I still needs that money to fills my daily needs and for other urgent situations. I only use some portion of my saving to invests in Bitcoin because that is what I can afford. I know having Bitcoin as the main investment will be the best thing that I can do but I need to be ready with anything that can happen such as worst economic situation which can makes every needs increase of the price. But I prepare some Bitcoins for my children and their future so they can use that when they are grow up including to survive if the situation really becomes worsen than now.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: I think it’s a great idea to start investing in Bitcoin for future generations. But, like any investment, it requires careful consideration and planning. I personally haven’t gone as far as putting most of my wealth into Bitcoin, but I’m certainly exploring ways to integrate it into my portfolio in a balanced way. It’s about finding that sweet spot between security and growth, while also educating future generations on how to manage these types of assets.I think the decision to commit to Bitcoin, whether for yourself or your children, comes down to your own convictions and financial goals. But it’s hard to ignore the potential long-term benefits of integrating Bitcoin into your wealth-building strategy.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: Where's actually his address? he's a popular person, there's no way for him to stay anonymous.I'm also fully committed in Bitcoin, if not 100%, we could say 99% because the 1% is fiat, for me to buy something or pay bills in my country. I don't like to give "money" as a gift,  it's pointless and this will make people can't appreciate your gift, instead they judge your gift based on how much the money you spent.

comments.author: CryptoBuds
comments.body: I also saw this news yesterday and this makes me more confident that the Trump administration will be a crypto friendly administration and the future of crypto will be better under him. Not only Robert Kennedy Jr, the Trump administration has a lot of politicians who support bitcoin and that is a good thing we expect. To be honest I am investing most of my money in bitcoin but not all, I still keep some money in the bank for emergencies and daily expenses. Currently, I have no intention of diversifying into other assets because my capital is not large and I don't think diversification will be good for my situation. As for using bitcoin as an inheritance for children, I think anyone who invests in bitcoin has thought about this even if they don't have children yet.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: He claims he invested most of his wealth in Bitcoin but reports show his investment is only between $100,001 and $250,000.... When you compare that to his $15 million net worth, it’s just 1.6% at most. So, how is that "most of his wealth"?Honestly, I don’t trust this guy. https://beincrypto.com/robert-kennedys-bitcoin-holdings-conflict-interest-debate/QuoteRobert Kennedy Bitcoin Holdings Under the MicroscopeKennedy’s recent financial disclosure that his family holds bitcoin in a brokerage account has created a conflict of interest debate. A report by CNBC recently revealed that his investments are valued between $100,001 and $250,000. Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. has an estimated net worth of $15 million, according to Forbes. 1

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: I simply want to remind everyone that Bitcoin is not a magic that fights inflation. I'll tell you how the price goes up, to be sure that it's not some sort of magic. When you invest, when I invest, when millions of people invest in a small, limited pool (I mean 21 Million supply), the price goes up but once we start cashing out, the price will go down. The one who cash outs Bitcoin, is the winner.If the USA invests in Bitcoin in order to repay its debt, this is what will happen in reality. The USA invests in Bitcoin, millions of people also invest in Bitcoin, some other countries invest in Bitcoin. Now there is a big pool of money, the USA decides to cash out Bitcoins and receive fiat, the price will significantly fall but the USA will receive its money. Do you wanna know what happened in reality? The USA took your money, the money that you invested. People can do the same if they cash out before the USA cash outs.So, I want to say that Bitcoin won't automatically fight inflation, it's impossible. When there is a winner, there is a loser, that's the balance in nature.Quote from: jcojci on November 19, 2024, 04:25:32 AMNo, I don't invested most of my money in Bitcoin because I still needs that money to fills my daily needs and for other urgent situations. I only use some portion of my saving to invests in Bitcoin because that is what I can afford. I know having Bitcoin as the main investment will be the best thing that I can do but I need to be ready with anything that can happen such as worst economic situation which can makes every needs increase of the price. But I prepare some Bitcoins for my children and their future so they can use that when they are grow up including to survive if the situation really becomes worsen than now.I'm on a boat with you. I'd really love to invest most of my money in Bitcoins but that's not possible because I still need some savings in cash. Bitcoin is volatile, if there is an emergency case, I would not wish to be the one who bought when price was high and sold when the price was low but at the moment I'm changing this situation for better or for worse because I believe that the Bull market is here, it's not going down anytime soon.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: kotajikikox on November 19, 2024, 02:48:50 AMHe says he’s fully committed to bitcoin. This means he believes in it as much as he says. No hesitation. What about you, did you put most of your money into bitcoin too? What are your thoughts about buying your children bitcoins as well? If you believe in Bitcoin, you need to invest your capital in Bitcoin first, invest for yourself. If possible, you can reserve part of your bitcoin for your children. It's your bitcoin first, and when time comes, it's your bitcoin like their inheritance from you.I don't see right idea to buy bitcoin for your children, while I am unsure that you are a Bitcoin investor or not, and whether you manage your finance well and healthy enough. Because if your individual and family finance is not too good, it's hard to avoid touching these bitcoins, either yours or your children. If you are a Bitcoin investor, you need to only invest money you can afford to lose it, and reserve money for other things like bills, emergency because you and your family surely need it.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: I don't know if he truly bought BTC for his children, but it is good to teach your children about finance, even if you don't buy them BTC, they should understand finance and different types of investment, of which BTC is one of them. I don't know much about Robert Kennedy Jr, but if he says he has put most of his wealth in BTC, then that is his choice, i don't care if he is telling the truth and it is even good publicity for BTC either way.

Sometimes we really have to take with a grain of salt of what this politicians do, just to be in power, they will say everything very positive to attract media and so they will be sensationalized in the news. It's good if he is speaking truthfully, but I for me, nah, he could be a pro-Bitcoin without putting all his money on it.As for his children that is good to hear. comments.author: icalical
comments.body: I personally wouldn't praise any politician, doesn't matter what they said or done about Bitcoin. But since Robert Kennedy Jr, has big platform and many followers, announcing that he gave Bitcoin tho his children could be followed by his follower and this means there will be more people enter into Bitcoin. But that is a big if, whether he is actually doing that, I mean we all know that politician would do anything, and lying is not out of the table. Don't get me wrong, I don't have anything against Robert Kennedy Jr, I am not even a US citizen, I am just concern that Bitcoin community is taken advantage by politician to gain popularity without actually care about Bitcoin or blockchain.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: kotajikikox on November 19, 2024, 02:48:50 AMHe says he’s fully committed to bitcoin. This means he believes in it as much as he says. No hesitation. What about you, did you put most of your money into bitcoin too? What are your thoughts about buying your children bitcoins as well? I invest in bitcoin too, but not most of my money because I have a lot to cover, and also I keep emergency funds in case anything happens. I suppose I have reserved funds that won’t touch my bitcoin investment. Howrvrt bitcoin investment is like a future investment that you won’t be touched anytime soon, so it’s good if he is committed to bitcoin. However, buying bitcoin for my children I feel like is a wise decision because it’s a future investment that you are doing for them ahead of their lives. We believe that bitcoin will be bigger than it’s currently worth right now, which means the children will enjoy their wealth in the future. It’s never a bad idea if we have money and invest for our children.
